text: --you even have to name two big banks.
Well that shouldn't be difficult you see them on every street corner.
--Well of course if you've some Chinese outfit look  --
--I mean you would know all this wouldn't you?
I have to say so, yes I know a lot about it.
Well I wonder what Lord Hanson will pay me for my I C I shares  --
--hoping that Lord Hanson will pay them more  --
You'll have to pay the bill won't you?
There's the man who owns Beaumont College now.
Saatchi Saatchi shows no signs of recovery.
Saatchi brothers salaries have been cut by a half  --
Robert Louis Briggs to run the company.
--Mr Arnold wanted to know why Maurice and Charles Saatchi were being paid such a ridiculously large salary when the state of the company was so absolutely dreadful.
Mr Maurice Saatchi who now gets three hundred and ten thousand pounds a year compared with six hundred thousand pounds a year two years ago replied I'm quite satisfied  --
--that involuntary taking a fifty per cent pay cut I have done the right thing.
--and then it got too big for them  --
--they are no longer able to control it  --
--they're not big enough for a big power  --
--two very big big brothers but they couldn't run a company the size they built it.
One is a (()) , one is an advertiser of embassy of the consulate, good combination.
--a gifted man reckons someone who knows how to handle the figures  --
--everyone knows that, he will tell you himself.
He's got better things to do than play around with columns and figures  (())
--like my spending my time on doors!
